title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

An answer of 20! 3 20  ⋅ 21 earns this point; no supporting work is necessary.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
General Scoring Notes:

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned by writing the ratio   ( −1 ) n+1 x n+1 3 n+1 ( n+2 )   ( −1 ) n x n 3 n ( n+1 ) , or the equivalent. The ratio can be written with or without absolute value symbols. Once earned this point cannot be lost. Any errors in simplification or evaluation of the limit will not earn the second point.

The ratio may be expressed in either of the forms a n+1 a n or a n a n−1 .

Read the second and third points with incorrect ratios. A response that presents no ratio does not earn the second point (computing the limit).

Proper limit notation must be used in order to earn the second point.

The third point is earned for |  x  |<3 or the equivalent.

A response that presents an incorrect limit is eligible for the third point. In this case the point would be earned for finding an interior interval of convergence that is consistent with a presented limit of the form L=|   x b   |, where b≠0.

A response of an infinite interval of convergence is not eligible for the fourth or fifth points.

A response that begins with |   x 3   |<1 or −3<x<3 does not earn the first two points, but does earn the third point and is eligible for the fourth and fifth points.

The fourth point is earned for considering both endpoints of the correct interval or of an incorrect interval that has earned the third point. The fifth point cannot be earned with an incorrect interval.

If the analysis at either endpoint is incorrect, the fifth point is not earned.

To earn the fifth point, the response must correctly analyze the series at each of the endpoints x=−3 and x=3 and must state the test(s) used for each analysis. A response does not need to address the conditions necessary to apply the test at each endpoint.

Alternative solution (root test): lim n→∞ x n 3 n ( n+1 ) n = lim n→∞ |  x  | 3  ⋅  1 ( n+1 ) 1 /  n

· The first point is earned for correctly setting up the root.

· The second point is earned for correctly evaluating the limit with complete support working using the indeterminate form ∞ 0 .

· The third, fourth, and fifth points are the same as for the model solution.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes three of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes four of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all five of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response must show supporting work in order to earn this point. For example: 1− 1 6 + 1 27 .

Read “ = ” as “ ≈ ”.

The approximation does not need to be simplified, but if simplification is presented it must be correct in order to earn the point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned for ( −1 ) 3 ( 1 ) 3 3 3 ( 4 ) or 1 108 or equivalent.

The first point is not earned for just stating that the error will be less than the absolute value of the fourth term. The value of the fourth term must be shown.

The justification does not require stating that 1 108 < 1 100 .

A response that never presents the value of the fourth term of the series, presents an incorrect evaluation of the fourth term, or evaluates some other term of the series is eligible for the second point but will not earn the first point.

To earn the second (justification) point, a response must state that  f ( 1 ) is an alternating series and that the terms decrease in absolute value to 0. The response must also either bound the error by 1 108 (or an equivalent expression), or state that the error is bounded by the fourth term.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.
